description.narrative: The Project consists of a green financing package of US$ 150 million (equivalent in INR) to the Kerala Infrastructure Investment Fund Board (KIIFB). The investment proceeds will be used to finance critical urban infrastructure for the Kerala State. The funds will be deployed across two components: (i) construction of four new water supply projects, and (ii) construction of four hospital expansions which are to be EDGE (Excellence in Design for Greater Efficiencies) certified.

The most significant outcome is for stakeholders, through improving access and quality of critical water and healthcare services in a region with inadequate water and sanitation levels as well as high exposure to climate vulnerabilities. Beyond the Project, the investment is expected to help enhance financial and climate resilience for subnational entities in India by demonstrating practices to address financial and climate vulnerabilities.
